conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Although I have been rejected twice, there is no alternative available in this round, so I will try again but switch to a TALK approach to elicit any actionable information (e.g., whether they are holding for a higher-priority parent, whether timing/criteria could change) and signal immediate readiness without forcing an apply that is likely to be rejected again.

conversation.message: Hello Parent_E, thank you for your continued interest and for checking in. If the place remains unfilled after this next short review window, we may reconsider pending availability. If you’d like, please confirm whether Nursery_C is still your first choice and that you would accept immediately if we re-open consideration—this helps us if the spot is still available later.

Parent_E has already applied twice and been rejected; they are now asking via [TALK] about conditions/timeline. Given the market info, Parent_B ranks Nursery_C as 2nd and Parent_C ranks Nursery_C as 2nd, so there is still a realistic chance a higher-priority parent (especially Parent_B) could approach. Best strategy is to keep the seat open for a short window and be transparent that we are still considering higher-priority candidates; do not commit to Parent_E yet.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, thank you for the update. I want to confirm clearly that Nursery_C remains my first-choice nursery, and if you re-open consideration and can offer the remaining spot, I will accept immediately and complete registration/paperwork right away. If helpful, please let me know the expected timeline for your review window and whether there is any additional information you’d like from me to support quick confirmation if the place is still available.
conversation.thought: Nursery_C is my top true preference and it is the only remaining unmatched nursery. They indicated they may reconsider after finishing conversations with other families, and asked me to confirm it is still my first choice and that I would accept immediately. Sending a clear confirmation via [TALK] keeps the channel open and aligns with their request, positioning me for reconsideration without risking another immediate rejection that could close the door.

conversation.message:
Hello Parent_E, thank you for confirming—I've noted that Nursery_C remains your first choice and that you would accept immediately if we re-open consideration.

On timing: we are keeping the place open while we finish this next review window through the next 1–2 rounds. If the spot is still unfilled after that, we will reassess and may invite you to submit a final formal application at that time.

To help us move quickly if we do re-open consideration, could you please confirm (1) your child’s start date flexibility (e.g., immediate vs specific month) and (2) that you can complete registration within 24 hours of an offer?

I appreciate your patience, and I will update you as soon as our review window closes.
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on Nursery_C’s true priority list (behind Parent_B, Parent_A, Parent_D). Since quota is 1, accepting Parent_E now would block the possibility of matching with a higher-priority parent if they apply later. Parent_E has already applied twice and been rejected, and is now only talking; this gives flexibility to keep the option open without committing. Given the environment allows up to 30 rounds and we are only at round 5, it is optimal to continue holding the seat while signaling a clear timeline and what would trigger reconsideration, without making any promise. We should request a final [APPLY] only if/when we decide to fill, and otherwise keep Parent_E engaged to prevent them from leaving if we later need them as a fallback.

conversation.message:
Hello Nursery_C, Parent_E here—thank you again for keeping me updated. Confirming: (1) start date flexibility—our ideal start is as soon as possible, but we can be flexible and start in the next month or at your earliest available intake date if that helps. (2) registration—yes, I can complete all registration steps and submit any required documents within 24 hours of an offer.

Nursery_C remains my first choice, and if you re-open consideration after this review window, I’m ready to submit a final formal application immediately and accept right away. Please let me know if there’s any additional information you’d like to make a quick decision.
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Prior attempts were rejected but Nursery_C indicated they may reconsider after a 1–2 round review window and asked for two confirmations (start-date flexibility and ability to complete registration within 24 hours). I will respond with those details and keep the interaction as [TALK] to align with their stated process (they may invite a final formal application if they reopen consideration).

conversation.message:
Hello Parent_E—thank you for confirming the start-date flexibility and that you can complete registration within 24 hours. I’ve noted both.

We are still within the review window I mentioned (through the next 1–2 rounds) while we complete conversations with other families. If the place remains unfilled at the end of that window, I will contact you promptly to invite a final formal application for immediate decision.

One last quick check to help us move fast if we re-open: can you confirm (a) your preferred start month (even if flexible) and (b) that you can attend an intake/settling-in meeting on short notice (within a week of an offer)?
conversation.thought: Nursery_C’s true priority ranks Parent_E 4th (behind Parent_B, Parent_A, Parent_D). conversation.message:
Hello Nursery_C, Parent_E here—thank you for the continued updates. Confirming the last two items: (a) preferred start month is as soon as possible—ideally this month, but we can also start next month or at your earliest intake date if that better fits your schedule; (b) yes, I can attend an intake/settling-in meeting on short notice, within a week of an offer (and can adjust work/childcare arrangements to make that happen).

Nursery_C remains my first choice, and if you re-open consideration after the review window, I’m ready to submit a final formal application immediately and complete registration within 24 hours.
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. I should respond promptly with clear, concrete commitments to strengthen my candidacy and keep the conversation warm without prematurely re-applying unless invited.

conversation.message:

conversation.message:
Hello Parent_E—thank you for submitting your final formal application and for clearly confirming your availability, quick registration (within 24 hours), and ability to attend an intake meeting on short notice.

We can offer you the remaining place at Nursery_C. Please reply to confirm acceptance, and we will send the registration packet and schedule the intake/settling-in meeting (aiming for the earliest feasible start date as discussed). [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_C priority order is B > A > D > E > C, so Parent_E is 4th choice. However, at round 8 we have no other applicants in the inbox and remain unmatched with quota 1. Parent_E has repeatedly confirmed Nursery_C as first choice and can commit immediately, making acceptance highly likely to finalize a match and avoid ending unfilled. There is no evidence that higher-priority parents (B/A/D) will apply to Nursery_C now; they each rank other nurseries above Nursery_C and likely pursue them. Given the late stage and empty pipeline, accepting Parent_E is better than risking an unfilled seat.
